sentences: Ivo Linna (born 12 June 1949 in Kuressaare) is an Estonian singer.

section: == Eurovision Song Contest and Eesti Laul ==

sentences: Eurovision Song Contest and Eesti Laul ==
section: == Eurovision Song Contest and Eesti Laul ==

sentences: He represented Estonia alongside Maarja Liis Ilus in the Eurovision Song Contest 1996 in Oslo with the song "Kaelakee Hääl" (The Sound of a Necklace) which finished 5th at the contest.
section: == Eurovision Song Contest and Eesti Laul ==

sentences: He competed in Eesti Laul 2017 with the song "Suur Loterii" (Big Lottery).
section: == Eurovision Song Contest and Eesti Laul ==

sentences: The song won its semi final, but came fifth of ten entries in the final round.
section: == Eurovision Song Contest and Eesti Laul ==

sentences: Together with his son Robert Linna and the Estonian band Supernova, Ivo participated in Eesti Laul 2021 with the song "Ma Olen Siin" (I'm Here).
section: == Eurovision Song Contest and Eesti Laul ==

sentences: The song finished in eleventh place of the twelve entries in the final round.
section: == Eurovision Song Contest and Eesti Laul ==

sentences: Linna is married to Reet Linna, and he is the father of singer Robert Linna.
In 2000, the President of Estonia decorated Linna with a IV Class Order of the White Star.
(2006)In addition to the albums mentioned above, Ivo Linna has released more albums with different rock acts of Estonia, like Apelsin and Rock Hotel.
